activities.loc: Monroe County Justice Center - Branch III

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan Robert Brandau

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan Robert Brandau appeared by phone.  Attorney Lucas Swank appeared by video for Ryan Robert Brandau.  Attorney Charles David Betthauser appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney wavies reading of criminal complaint. Court enters not guilty pleas.
Pre-trial offer: 10/10/22
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/Schedule scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose. 
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  
DEFENDANT MUST GO IMMEDIATELY TO THE JUSTICE PROGRAMS OFFICE UPON SIGNING OF BOND AND/OR RELEASE.  
THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM IS LOCATED IN THE MONROE COUNTY JUSTICE CENTER AT 112 SOUTH COURT STREET, ROOM 1008, SPARTA, WI.

Defendant Ryan Robert Brandau appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Croninger appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hammer appears via zoom video. E. Weihe from Justice Department appears via zoom video. Justice Department speaks regarding alcohol bracelet. Court orders $2,000 signature bond with conditions. Court schedules with branch 3.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.
